intro: Cephalaria leucantha var. fragosoana, commonly known as the fragosoana cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in mountainous areas and thrives in well-drained soils. Its foliage is often hairy, and it produces showy yellow to orange flower heads that attract pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
